title: How Do We Know How close you are to honor 3?
body: just really wondering on how we know how close we are to getting the next honor is there something i'm missing, cause i have played a few games now and got honored in all of them, got honored by 3 people at once which gave the little message, and not honor 3 yet. Any help?

replies.body:
There's no visible way to tell, you just have to stay consistent.  Per the [honor guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008474148), getting honor only slightly boosts the progression and it will come in time. 
 Just enjoy the ride and remain honorable, the goodies will come friend!
I don't know if this is the right place to ask but I'll ask anyway. Is there any concern that people might dodge if they're queued with someone who is unhonorable / toxic / below level 2?

Dishonorable players aren't immune from reform.  They are still members of the community and deserve the chance to redeem their honor to show they are stand up summoners.  If someone wants to dodge as a result, I'd be sorry to see that.
What about players like Tyler1? Surely he's reformed enough by now. {{champion:119}}
Dishonorable players aren't immune to reform? What a joke, where's tyler1's unban? He's played 1,000 games without getting an infraction
does it reset honor if u are reported like we cant see how close we are to honor 3 but does that reset when we get reported and we this this mjuch more to get to honor 3 again
you only see it at loading screen so low chance of dodge for that reason
Wait, what? Are we able to see if someone is "dishonorable" in loading screen?
my bad, here is actually no way of telling whi is dishonored, only 3 and above can be known, and not in lobby i think
No. You only get loading screen flair if your're at honor level 3 AND received either one honor from a stranger or two honors from your premade group in your last game.

But isn't the progress of honor reset after every season? Is that enough time for casual players to reach the higher ranks. Not saying for people to farm it but how does this help people who simply have limited time? Can they still achieve the highest rank? Or will they always be at the disadvantage due to their work, social, or family life.

Ok so I read the honor guide, and I personally see 1 major issue, and have a couple questions. 1st is the major issue, it says, and i quote; 

"Can I game the system and boost to level 5 by constantly playing with a premade and honoring each other every game?
That’s a great idea. Luckily, we’ve broken a few systems in our day, too. So we specifically built Honor so potential exploits like this give you (and your friend) literally no benefit." 

I understand the idea behind not letting people get around the honor system this way, but in doing it this way, you are forcing people to pick between playing with their friends, and getting/maintaining honor. I feel this is a massive flaw in the honor system, because i personally want to play with my friends, and love playing with full premade teams, be it in ranked or normals, just because we get to do silly stuff like 5 smite, but I also would like to get honor. 

As far as my questions, will there ever be an time when we can honor enemies, and can we honor multiple people? I have already had multiple games where I want to honor more than just 1 friend, as well as some of my enemies.
Honor levels are not instantly granted, but instead is a gradual progression as you play your matches
